meanings.definition: on or onto a ship, aircraft or bus
shorten without loosing sense
serious and determined
meanings.example: An earnest student

meanings.definition: relating to church; churchly
during the course of a journey; on the way
meanings.example: Universities offering an eclectic mix of courses

meanings.definition: liquid waste or sewage discharged into a river or the sea
meanings.example: Industrial effluent

meanings.definition: during the course of a journey; on the way
meanings.example: I stopped in Delhi en route to Guwahati

meanings.definition: happen or occur afterwards or as a result
the action of expelling someone from a property; expulsion
make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse
meanings.meaning: The solution proposed by the teacher exacerbated the doubt of students

meanings.definition: irritate and frustrate someone
unusual and exciting because it is foreign, unfamiliar, or different
meanings.example: Exotic plants, exotic dishes

meanings.definition: to make something happen more quickly
meanings.example: Expedite the process

meanings.definition: making amends or reparation for guilt
meanings.example: An act of public expiation

meanings.definition: to explain something in detail, especially a piece of writing  or an idea
meanings.example: This book clearly explicates the writer's ideas

meanings.definition: (of the state or an authority) take (property) from its owner for public use or benefit
to involve someone or something in a complicated situation
meanings.example: His reckless actions embroiled the company in a legal dispute

meanings.definition: (of a person) famous and respected within a particular sphere
meanings.example: An eminent mathematician

meanings.definition: (of a positive quality) present to a notable degree
meanings.example: Eminent sense of humour

meanings.definition: strong and determined in speech or action
meanings.example: She was emphatic about going to the school trip

meanings.definition: an attempt to achieve something
meanings.example: He endeavoured to locate the bug in the code

meanings.definition: (of a disease) occurring within an area or community
meanings.example: Malaria is endemic in the hotter regions of the world

meanings.definition: (of a plant or animal) native and restricted to a certain place
meanings.example: Kiwi is endemic to New Zealand

meanings.definition: to make a public statement of your approval or support for something or someone
meanings.example: I fully endorse everything the Chairperson has said

meanings.definition: to cause or give rise to a feeling, situation, or condition
meanings.example: Her latest book has engendered a lot of controversy

meanings.definition: a feeling of boredom or weariness
meanings.example: He experienced a sense of ennui after spending too much time indoors

meanings.definition: to establish firmly and securely
meanings.example: Racism is entrenched in our society

meanings.definition: assign the responsibilty for doing something to (someone)
meanings.example: I've been entrusted with the task of helping him in his homework
